newsitem.title: FRANCE: France's Jospin pledges independent justice system.
newsitem.headline: France's Jospin pledges independent justice system.

text.p: French Prime Minister Lionel Jospin pledged on Thursday to shield the justice system from political meddling by protecting investigating judges from government interference.

"I announce solemnly that from today, no instructions will be given by the justice minister that might affect the pursuit of an individual investigation," he said in a keynote policy address to the National Assembly.
Jospin said the appointment process for investigating judges would be reformed to assure that only candidates approved by the Higher Magistrates Council (CSM) be named.
He also pledged a constitutional amendment setting the aim of parity betwen men and women in French public life.
"An independent justice system and respect for the law are fundamental to the republic and to democracy," Jospin said. "Justice must be independent and impartial."

Protecting France's justice system from political influence was a key Socialist promise during last month's parliamentary election campaign. New Socialist Justice Minister Elisabeth Guigou this month that her top priority would be to restore confidence in the system and ensure its independence.
